source: 'Convert' effects included in the image style specified will not be effective. It is not possible to change the image format based on the aspect. If you need to change the image format, you will have to add a 'Convert' effect in this image style.
Crop text. Only the part of the text fitting in the image is rendered.
Exact. The image will be rotated exactly by the degrees indicated.
Extend image. The underlying image will be extended to fit the text.
Pseudo-random. The image will be rotated within a range +/- the degrees indicated, based on a pseudo-random algorithm that uses the image source URI for input.
Random. The image will be rotated randomly within a range +/- the degrees indicated.
Scale text. The text will be scaled to fit the underlying image.

Certain cameras can embed orientation information into image files when they save them. This information is embedded in an EXIF tag and can be used to rotate images to their correct position for display. Not all cameras or images contain this information. This process is only useful for images that contain this information, whereas for other images it is harmless.

Although most modern browsers do support the orientation tag, the information may get lost or become incorrect by other operations. So, to support all browsers and prevent rotation errors, it is better to start each image style with this effect.

The expected/supported values are:
Tag: 0x0112 Orientation

  • 1 = Horizontal (normal)
  • 3 = Rotate 180
  • 6 = Rotate 90 CW
  • 8 = Rotate 270 CW

Wikipedia: Exchangeable image file format

Enter the command line arguments only.
Remember to escape parenthesis (and remember escaping is platform specific, use \\ on *nix and ^ on Windows).
Do not add an input or output file. Drupal ImageAPI will add "convert" before and a "-quality" option after based on the toolkit configuration settings.
Keep dimensions. Pass through the current image dimensions. Use if the arguments specified above do not change image size.
Manual input. If you know the size of the image that the arguments specified above will produce, specify them below, either in pixels or as % of the current image dimensions.

Strip dimensions. This won't pass on any image dimensions. Images will have no HTML width and height attributes if this effect is the last in the image style. Use this if you have another dimension altering effect after this.

A Gaussian blur is generated by replacing each pixel's color values with the average of the surrounding pixels' colors. This region is a circle whose radius is given by the 'radius' argument. Thus, a larger 'radius' will yield a blurrier image. This average is not a simple mean of the values. Instead, values are weighted using the Gaussian function (roughly a bell curve centered around the destination pixel) giving it much more influence on the result than its neighbours. Thus, a fatter curve will give the center pixel more weight and make the image less  blurry; lower 'sigma' values will yield flatter curves.
A label to identify this filter effect.
A percentage crop can not be higher than the source image.
A percentage crop can not be wider than the source image.
Access a list of fonts stored in the directory specified in configuration.
Access a list of images stored in the directory specified in configuration.
Action to take if text overflows the underlying image.
Action when text wrapper overflows canvas
Additional horizontal offset from placement. Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent of the canvas width. '+' or no sign shifts the mask rightward, '-' sign leftward.
Additional horizontal offset from placement. Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent of the canvas width. '+' or no sign shifts the watermark rightward, '-' sign leftward.
Additional vertical offset from placement. Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent of the canvas height. '+' or no sign shifts the mask downward, '-' sign upward.
Additional vertical offset from placement. Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent of the canvas height. '+' or no sign shifts the watermark downward, '-' sign upward.
Allow upscaling to have a percentage scale higher than the source image.
Allow upscaling to have a percentage scale wider than the source image.
Allows to choose image styles to apply based on orientation (portrait or landscape)
Allows typing in the font file URI/path.
Allows typing in the image file URI/path.
An URI, an absolute path, or a relative path. Relative paths will be resolved relative to the Drupal installation directory.
Applies a mask to the source image.
Apply a mask to the image
Apply a mask to the image.
At least one of 'Landscape image style' or 'Portrait image style' must be selected.
Automatically adjusts the orientation of an image.
Automatically rotates images according to orientation flag set by many phones and digital cameras.
Blur the image with a Gaussian operator
Blur the image with a Gaussian operator.
Cannot find image style '%style_name' to execute an 'aspect switcher' effect.
Change overall image transparency level. Applies only to image formats that support Alpha channel, like PNG.
Choose an image style to convert
Choose image styles to use depending on the orientation of the source image (landscape/protrait).
Color to be used when extending the underlying image
Convert the input text to a desired format. The default makes no changes to input text.
Could not build a preview of the text overlay.
Create an interlaced PNG or GIF or progressive JPEG image.
Define the size of the working canvas and background color, this controls the dimensions of the output image.
Determine how the rotation angle is calculated

Dimensions are stored in the Drupal image object and used for output HTML image (img) element width and height attributes. They have no effect on the real size of the image, but may affect the display.
It's not possible to detect the dimensions of the Imagemagick command's result image in the scope of this effect, so you have to decide what dimensions to pass to ImageAPI here.
Directly enter ImageMagick command line arguments
Directly enter ImageMagick/GraphicsMagick command line arguments.
Directly execute ImageMagick command line arguments.
Draws  a rectangle on the image, optionally filling it in with a specified color.
Draws on the image a line of the specified color.
Draws on the image an ellipse of the specified color.
Either an Horizontal or a Vertical mirroring must be selected.
Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent. Leave blank to keep source image height.
Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent. Leave blank to keep source image width.
Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent. Leave blank to scale according to new height.
Enter a value, and specify if pixels or percent. Leave blank to scale according to new width.
Enter the angle in degrees at which the text will be displayed. Positive numbers rotate the text clockwise, negative numbers counter-clockwise.

Enter the default text string for this effect. You can also enter tokens, that will be resolved when applying the effect. Note: only global tokens can be resolved by standard Drupal Image field formatters and widgets. The Textimage module provides a formatter that can also resolve node, file and user tokens.
Enter the size of the text to be generated.
Fallback color for full transparency, when image or toolkit do not support it
Forces the crop to be a square. Applies if only one crop dimension is set, and specified as % of the source image.
If checked, HTML entities will be decoded. For example, '<kbd>&quot;Title&quot;:&nbsp;One</kbd>' will be converted to <kbd>'"Title": One</kbd>'.
If checked, HTML tags will be stripped from the text. For example, '<kbd><p>Para1</p><!-- Comment --> Para2</kbd>' will be converted to '<kbd>Para1 Para2</kbd>'.
If checked, the source image will be 'flipped' vertically.
If checked, the source image will be 'flopped' horizontally.
If checked, the width will always be equal to the maximum width.
If n = (width/height)*ratio is greater than 1, use 'landscape', otherwise use 'portrait'.
If selected, the crop will not be executed; the crop area will be highlighted on the source image instead.
Image background failed using the %toolkit toolkit on %path

Image mask failed using the %toolkit toolkit on %path
Image rotate failed using the %toolkit toolkit on %path (%mimetype, %dimensions)
Image style machine_name for landscape orientation
Image style machine_name for portrait orientation
Image to use for masking. The mask file should be a grayscale image, where full white pixels will let the original image through, and full black pixels will hide it.
Image watermark failed using the %toolkit toolkit on %path
Lay the image over a colored canvas.
Let scale make images larger than their original size.
Location of the directory where the background images are stored.
Location of the directory where the fonts are stored.
Make width/height the same if one dimension is not specified

Maximum width of the text image, inclusive of padding. Text lines wider than this will be wrapped. Set to 0 to disable wrapping. Note: in case of rotation, the width of the final image rendered will differ, to accommodate the rotation. If you need a strict width/height, add image resize/scale/crop effects afterwards.
Mirror the image horizontally and/or vertically
Mirror the image horizontally and/or vertically.
No font specified. Select a font and click on 'Refresh preview'.
No fonts available. Make sure at least one font is available in the directory specified in the configuration page.
No images available. Make sure at least one image is available in the directory specified in the configuration page.

Note that colorshift is a mathematical filter that doesn't always have the expected result. To shift an image precisely TO a target color, desaturate (greyscale) it before colorizing. The hue (color wheel) is the direction the existing colors are shifted. The tone (inner box) is the amount. Keep the tone half-way up the left site of the color box for best results.
Opacity of the source image when overlaid on the background image, in percentage. 0% means fully transparent, 100% fully opaque.
Opacity, in percentage, of the watermark on the canvas. 0% is fully transparent, 100% is fully opaque.
Optionally add an outline or shadow around the font. Enter the information in pixels.
Overlays a given text into the image.
Overlays text on the image, defining text font, size and positioning.
Overlays text over a GD resource.
Overlays text over a wrapper image

Path where image files can be found
Places the source image anywhere over a selected background image.
Places the source image over a background image.
Position of the image on the canvas.

Provides effects and operations for the Image API.
Relative paths will be resolved relative to the Drupal installation directory.
Replace each pixel with its complementary color.
Replace the current image with another one.
Represents the 'fatness' of the Gaussian curve. Lower values mean less blurry image. Leave blank to use toolkit's default. As a guideline, 2/3 of the radius is a good starting point.
Resize the image by percentage of its width/height. If only a single dimension is specified, the other dimension will be calculated, maintaining the aspect ratio (scale).
Resizing will make images match a ratio, for example 4:3 or 16:9. Images that are wider than the ratio will be cropped in width, images that are higher than the ratio will be cropped in height.
Rotate the image by a specified angle, optionally setting the background color.
Scan EXIF data when calculating styled image dimensions
Select a color to be used for transparency of GIF image files. Leave the checkbox ticked to use the color of the image being processed, if it has one.
Select an algorithm to use to determine the crop area.

Select dimensions either in pixels or as percentage of the current canvas. Leaving one dimension empty will resize the mask maintaing its aspect ratio. Leave both dimensions empty to apply the mask in its original dimensions.

Select dimensions either in pixels or as percentage of the current canvas. Leaving one dimension empty will resize the watermark maintaing its aspect ratio. Leave both dimensions empty to apply the watermark in its original dimensions.
Select how the text should be aligned within the resulting image. The default aligns to the left.
Select the color you wish to use for the background of the text.
Select the font to be used in this image.
Set the canvas to a precise size, possibly cropping the image. Use to start with a known size.
Set the canvas to a relative size, based on the current image dimensions. Use to add simple borders or expand by a fixed amount. Negative values may crop the image.
Set the color to be used when extending the underlying image.
Set the image transparent color for GIF images.
Similar to Crop, but preserves the portion of the image with the most entropy.
Similar to Scale And Crop, but preserves the portion of the image with the most entropy.
Similar to Scale and Crop, but preserves the portion of the image with the most entropy.
Some image formats do not support transparency. This color will be used in place of transparent in such cases.
Specify the padding in pixels to be added around the generated text.
Specify the space in pixels to be added between text lines (Leading). Can be negative.
Specify the type of interlacing scheme.
Text associated with this effect, can include tokens
Text to append at the end of the trimmed text string when it exceeded maximum characters threshold
Text to append to the end of the source text, after trimming.

The GD Library for PHP is enabled, but was compiled without FreeType support. Image effects using fonts will not be available with the GD image toolkit.
The Textimage module is not installed. It is not possible to provide the text overlay preview image.
The anchor that will be used to crop images that are higher than the configured ratio.
The anchor that will be used to crop images that are wider than the configured ratio.
The background color to use for the areas of the image that remain exposed by the rotation.
The brightness effect seldom looks good on its own, but can be useful to wash out an image before making it transparent - e.g. for a watermark.
The contrast effect enhances the intensity differences between the lighter and darker elements of the image.
The image %file could not be rotated because the imagerotate() function is not available in this PHP installation.
The image style does not exist.
The maximum allowed characters of text. Text longer than this will be trimmed. Leave blank for no limit.
The number of degrees the image should be rotated. Positive numbers are clockwise, negative are counter-clockwise.
The radius of the blur, in pixels. The larger the radius, the slower the operation is. However, too small radius can lead to undesired aliasing effects.
The selected file does not exist.
The value of sigma must be lower than the radius.
This allows you to bend the rules for how different the proportions need to be to trigger the switch
This allows you to bend the rules for how different the proportions need to be to trigger the switch.
This value is added to the division result.
This will have the effect of adding colored (or transparent) margins around the image.
Use Line or Plane to create an interlaced PNG or GIF or progressive JPEG image. This setting is not relevant for the GD image toolkit.
Use a Farbtastic color picker to select colors.
Use a JQuery color picker to select colors.
Use an HTML5 color element to select colors.
When ratio = 1 (the default) it will just switch between portrait and landscape modes.

When selected, original image files supporting EXIF data (e.g. JPEG, TIFF) will be scanned to determine styled image orientation and dimensions. This slightly impacts performance, but allows to render more accurate HTML <kbd><img></kbd> tags.
